nit: wrapping off in a few places
Done

Whether it is merged into our OpenBMC linux repo or not?
If not what's the impact?

Hi Kuiying,the CLD driver has not been merged. 
If the user does not config cpld_definitions, the button service will not be affected
By default, it is not defined right?
Hi Kuiying, yes. The gpio_defs.json is all defined by the user.

ok, great.
It is a good approach overall.
Cool.
nit: string constructor does this by default
Done
Why did you remove the read() that was being done here?
Hi Matt, because it seems to just read the file content but not use it.

I remember I had to put those in quite awhile ago, though the code has been rewritten a lot since then: https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-buttons/commit/b3d86c9f0a7487b8f22c656da675ab971a6e058c

Does your system still have the normal GPIO based buttons so you can confirm these spurious callback don't occur?

Hi Matt, thanks for your info. 
After I use the gpio config in our system, when the service start up the handler service do have a singal log happened. 
The signal won't pop up after I add the read before sd_event_add_io.
The commit had been changed, please check it. Thx

Hi Matt, because in our CLD driver it needs to read two bytes at the time (one is value, the other is line feed) 
We will survey if we could remove out that line feed char in our driver.
Was there a particular reason you changed this to 2?

Hi Matt, because in our CLD driver it needs to read two bytes at the time (one is value, the other is line feed)
We will survey if we could remove out that line feed char in our driver.

Hi all, we already updated our CLD driver for one byte valid. And modified our code to read one byte at a time. But the CI fail because of power interface yaml has been changed. Even this commit doesn't modify power button but still needs to wait until https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-buttons/+/59701 merged first.

Is this correct naming convention? 

It should be upper camel case rt?
Done

Suggestion:
if (fd)

Hi Arun Lal K M, thanks for your suggestion. 
May I ask why if (fd) is more appropriate? Because it might have a situation when fd is negative.
Because there is no reply for a while. Set to resolved.
upper camel case
Done
give better names to variable
Done
hmm, i wonder what the reason was for this being a global. (it's possible i'm the one that did it)
Done
if cpld_definitions isn't present, won't this crash?
Hi Matt, it won't crash. The cpldDefs only get the size of zero json element if "cpld_definitions" doesn't find. And it won't go into the for loop.
Done

Does anyone know how to handle the ci fail problem? It seems to get the latest phosphor-dbus-interfaces, but currently, the openbmc SRCREV hasn't updated to the latest one. I'm a bit confused about it.
Done
